intro: Zeyheria velloziana, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or yellow star goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in wetlands and riparian areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Zeyheria velloziana is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its vibrant foliage and unique floral display.
